title: Biochar
summary: Biochar is charcoal that is produced by pyrolysis of biomass in the absence of oxygen; it is used as a soil amendment.[1] Biochar is defined by the International Biochar Initiative as "The solid material obtained from the thermochemical conversion of biomass in an oxygen-limited environment".[2] Biochar is a stable solid that is rich in carbon and can endure in soil for thousands of years.[3]
